page.title: 19LLANSTEFFAN AREA: INTERESTS
page.content: Our gardens bear witness to our love of gardening. Walking is enjoyed too. Many women knit and sew. We have a number of gifted artists and photographers and we have annual exhibitions of their work. Famous modern stained-glass artist John Petts lived here and made the spectacular East Window in Llansteffan Church. Our particular local charity is the Coomb Cheshire Home. The Women's Institutes make a noticeable contribution to community life. Many retired people join Llansteffan Evergreen club. There are amenity groups e.g. Local History society, CPRW and West Wales Nature Conservation Trust. We have no Young Farmers Club but young people join nearby clubs. We have Brownie Guides, Cub Scouts and a school PTA. Farmers have the National Farmers' Union and the Farmers' Union of Wales.
